alert.note: Alert for Wallowa (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 10:09PM PDT until May 10 at 9:16PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Imnaha River at Imnaha affecting Wallowa County. For the Imnaha River...including Imnaha...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, MAY 10... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Imnaha River at Imnaha. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM PDT Monday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 6.0 feet Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 12/12/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
